title: PBS Now - 20081010
description:
Video: Driven to DespairWith gas prices spiking and home values crumbling, the American dream of commuting to work from the fringes of suburbia has become an American nightmare. Many are facing a hard choice: Paying for gas or paying the mortgage. How did it come to this? It&#039;s not just about America&#039;s financial crisis; it&#039;s also about big problems with our national infrastructure. Overstressed highways and too few public transportation options are wreaking havoc on people&#039;s lives and hitting the brakes on our already-stretched economy.

This week, NOW on PBS takes a close-up look at our inadequate transportation network and visits some people paying a high priceÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½in both dollars and quality of lifeÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½just to get to work. Do we have the means to modernize both our infrastructure and our lifestyles?

This is the first installment in "Blueprint America," a year-long, PBS-wide series focusing on the nation&#039;s infrastructure. "Blueprint America" is an initiative of Thirteen/WNET.

More Info: http://www.pbs.org/now/shows/440/index.html
